title: Ticket #3206: condor_q misses job ads when schedd version unknown
description:
In CondorQ::fetchQueueFromHostAndProcess(), ExprTreeToString() is called to unparse a constraint expression. When useFastPath is false, the unparsed string is passed to repeated calls of GetNextJobByConstraint(), interspersed with calls to a caller-provided function pointer. If the caller-provided function also calls ExprTreeToString(), then the constraint is overwritten and subsequent calls to GetNextJobByConstraint() use an invalid argument.

A user on condor-users reported a problem where, with the right arguments, condor_q printed results for only one of many ads in the schedd. Their condor_q didn't know the version of the schedd, so it used the old code path (useFastPath=false). The first call to GetNextJobByConstraint() had the correct unparsed constraint (true), but subsequent calls had the constraint string "Req, due to an interspersed call of ExprTreeToString().

The fix is to have CondorQ::fetchQueueFromHostAndProcess() copy the string returned by ExprTreeToString().
